trans-unit.target: TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_SEQ_00<tab>Gosetsu is brimming with indignation.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Sadu.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Gosetsu.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_TODO_02<tab>Gather information at Dotharl Khaa.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Gosetsu.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_DOTHARL02511_000_000<tab>Thank you again, but I shall manage on my own.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_GOSETSU_000_010<tab>Forgive me, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, but I cannot in good conscience ignore the callous disregard that woman showed for her kinsman!
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_GOSETSU_000_011<tab>We must seek her out at once! With me!
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_GOSETSU_000_020<tab>Such contempt as was in their eyes I have never known... But for the soul to live on as they say is not something I can so easily accept.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_GOSETSU_000_021<tab>Do they truly believe this? All of them? That in death there can be rebirth? ...Retribution?
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_GOSETSU_000_022<tab>...In any event, we came here in search of information. We cannot leave without speaking with her people.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_GOSETSU_000_030<tab>Err...that is to say, then, that death is essentially meaningless?
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_KOKO_000_040<tab>I know you! Reunion! The travelers with the Mol girl!
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_KOKO_000_041<tab>I marked you after I left the Oronir. Ones from Doma, others I could not place.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_KOKO_000_042<tab>My name is Koko. Welcome to Dotharl Khaa.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_KOKO_000_043<tab>Hm? Koko sounds to your ear the name of a woman? Well, of course. That would be because it is.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_KOKO_000_044<tab>I died a woman and was reborn a man. It is of no moment─the soul is the soul, and the flesh the flesh.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_KOKO_000_045<tab>Perhaps you scoff? Many would. Many look only to the name and the flesh, and let these things dictate their perceptions.

TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_KOKO_000_046<tab>Consider Sadu Khatun. Three times before she died a man, yet she returns as a woman the fourth. Yet she is no less fierce, and any outsider foolish enough to think so will learn the truth to their peril.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_KOKO_000_047<tab>Is the khatun woman or man? A stupid question. She is Sadu.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_QOYAR_000_050<tab>The cycle of death and rebirth? It is simply that. Take me─I died in battle with the Hotgo. Fiercely did I fight, and so I returned.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_QOYAR_000_051<tab>Alas, we know naught of our past lives. I must learn what it means to be Qoyar again and again. It is difficult to remember everything, but important.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_QOYAR_000_052<tab>It filled me with such excitement when they first told me of my deeds, as did my friends!
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_MERGEN_000_060<tab>Impressive, is it not? 'Twas slain by my boy.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_MERGEN_000_061<tab>We were childhood friends, he and I, before he fell and returned. A master of the bow. It is good to see that he retains his skill.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_MERGEN_000_062<tab>We competed against one another in the hunts. Though I knew he would return, I never expected it to be as my son!
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_GOSETSU_000_070<tab>Ah, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. You have completed your inquiries?
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_GOSETSU_000_071<tab>Aye, it is as she said. They believe with every fiber of their being that their bravest warriors will be reborn.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_GOSETSU_000_072<tab>As for me, I observed some of their warriors at practice. They are as formidable as the Oronir, perhaps more, and their weapons are their equal as well.
TEXT_STMBDA413_02512_GOSETSU_000_073<tab>Yet while they do not lack in skill and resources, 'tis plain to see that their numbers are inferior...
